donor_name: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC
Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade of the Republic of korea
outputs.output_descr:
The global project 2009-2013 builds on UNDP track record in the area of promoting aid effectiveness for development effectiveness. It seeks to scale up support to programme countries' capacities to receive, manage and use aid as one of the instruments at their disposal to achieve their development objectives. 

Output 1: 
Strengthened country capacities to manage aid by articulating national policy frameworks and action plans, corresponding aid management tools through tailored capacity development support, peer learning and South-South exchange.

Output 2: 
Strengthened capacities of UNDP at country, regional and global levels to lead with the UN and Resident Coordinator system in the implementation of  international commitments on aid quality and to assist the UNCTs, through UNDG and the RC system, in the delivery of better, timely, cost-effective and efficient support to programme countries

donor_name: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
outputs.output_descr:
The USAID Grant in support of capacity development for aid effectiveness contributes to the global project 2009-2011, which builds on UNDP track record in the area of promoting aid effectiveness for development effectiveness. It seeks to scale up support to programme countries' capacities to receive, manage and use aid as one of the instruments at their disposal to achieve their development objectives.                                                                   

USAID's grant specifically contributes to Output 1: 
Strengthened country capacities to manage aid by articulating national policy frameworks and action plans, corresponding aid management tools through tailored capacity development support, peer learning and South-South exchange.

The Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness (2005) commits donors and partner countries to achieving tangible progress against a set of agreed indicators on aid effectiveness by 2010. The 2011 Survey on Monitoring the Paris Declaration is the mechanism through which key stakeholders will determine whether these targets have been met. Its results will form a key input to the Fourth High Level Forum on Aid Effectiveness (Korea, November 2011).
Building on their successful partnership to date and significant track record in supporting partner country leadership and participation in the survey process, the OECD and United Nations Development Programme will, in collaboration with interested donors and regional stakeholders, deliver a package of support focused around five regional workshops to ensure the successful roll-out of the 2011 PD Survey. Linkages with other monitoring activities  including the 2011 Fragile States Principles Survey  will be made, ensuring useful synergies and cost-effectiveness.
These workshops will ensure that key partner country stakeholders involved in the management of the Surveys are briefed on the process and technical aspects of the 2011 Surveys, and will offer an opportunity for partner country practitioners to exchange experiences and best practice around the Paris monitoring processes, further strengthening ownership and participation in preparation for the Fourth High Level Forum on Aid Effectiveness. It will provide a timely opportunity to share progress on the preparations for HLF4 and seek partner country perspectives on what HLF4 should seek to achieve.
This proposal forms part of UNDP's Global Project on Capacity Development for Aid Effectiveness 2009-2011.

project_descr: Strengthened developing country capacities to integrate into the global economic system, negotiate and manage development finance, and to advocate for global policy coherence in the context of MDG8
